definition: (old) to fight on the leitai/(fig.) to enter a contest
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
martial arts competition/tournament/to compete in a contest
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb/to get into confrontation
real swords, real spears (idiom)/real weapons/very much for real/every bit real/the genuine article
to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to compare notes/to learn from one another/to swap pointers
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
to challenge an opponent to a fight
to invite the groom (who will live with the bride's family)/to take a wife by one's own choice
(fig.) to fight a one-sided battle/to have an unfair advantage in a contest
